metadata.name: Time Traveling Hyperbug
metadata.description:
Time Traveling Hyperbug, 2023 | Digital painting | 5000 x 6500 pixels | 300 DPI | PNG

In 2087, humanity has harnessed the power of time travel, but the process is dangerous and often fatal due to ​​hyperbugs in the code that cause the traveler's persona to be duplicated and scattered across time. Because of the risky nature of this model, only a special group of comrades is genetically engineered to travel through time. These workers, called conDevs (continuum developers) are kept in stasis until they are needed for a mission.

This is the story of one conDev, named Zephyr, who is sent back in time to prevent a catastrophic event that threatens the future of humanity. Zephyr's mission is to find a scientist named Dr. Kessler, who is willing to disrupt the delicate space-time equilibrium.

As Zephyr travels through different eras to get closer to Dr. Kessler, she realizes that the scientist wants to use the time-travel software in a self-interested way to prevent a personal tragedy that happened in his own past. Zephyr is faced now with a moral dilemma: should she stop Dr. Kessler to, theoretically, maintain the course of history, or would that potentially create a new future?
